channel.title: Git on jdhao's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Git on jdhao's blog

item.title: Git Learning Notes (1)
item.description: This is my personal note of learning Git.

item.title: Handling Merge Conflict after Git Stash
item.description: Sometimes, when you are working with your local changes, you may want to pull the latest updates from the remote Git repository. You can use git stash to store the unfinished work temporarily.

item.title: How to Push Local Git Repo to Remote Repo in GitHub
item.description: There are two basic cases when we push our local repo to remote repo. These two cases differ in their settings. But sometimes, we are easily confused. First scenario The first case is that you have created a local repo and want to store it on GitHub later. In this case, your usual work flow for local repo is: Initialize the local repo (git init) Write you code and document, etc.

item.title: A Tutorial on Creating GitHub Pull Requests
item.description: Today I make my first ever GitHub pull request to the great Hexo theme NexT. I will summarize how to make a pull request in following post. Creating a fork According to GitHub documentation: If you don’t have write access to the repository where you’d like to create a pull request, you must create a fork, or copy, of the repository first. If you do not have write access to the repository you want to contribute to, the first step is to fork it.
